CE221.name: Statics
CE221.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE221.description: Vector description of forces and moments. Two- and three- dimensional equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies. Analysis of trusses, frames, and machines. Coulomb friction.
CE221.prerequisite: {(PHY 183 or PHY 183B or PHY 193H) or (PHY 231 and PHY 233B)} and ((MTH 234 or concurrently) or (LB 220 or concurrently) or (MTH 254H or concurrently))

CE273.name: Civil and Environmental Engineering Measurements
CE273.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE273.description: Measurements, surveying and error analysis with applications to civil and environmental engineering problems
CE273.prerequisite: ((MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently)) and (EGR 102 or concurrently)

CE274.name: Graphics for Civil and Environmental Engineers
CE274.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE274.description: Basic operations in CAD software with applications in civil and environmental engineering
CE274.prerequisite: ((MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently)) and (EGR 100 or concurrently)

CE280.name: Principles of Environmental Engineering and Science
CE280.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE280.description: Physical, chemical and biological processes related to environmental science and engineering. Environmental systems analysis with application to air, water and soil. Analysis of environmental problems and development of engineering solutions.
CE280.prerequisite: (CEM 141 or CEM 151 or LB 171) and ((MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently))

CE305.name: Introduction to Structural Analysis
CE305.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE305.description: Theory of structural analysis for statically determinate structures. Qualitative structural analysis and behavior. Load estimation and placement. Introduction to structural analysis computer software. Introduction to statically indeterminate structures.
CE305.prerequisite: ME 222 and (CE 273 or concurrently) and (CE 274 or concurrently)
CE305.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering.

CE312.name: Soil Mechanics
CE312.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE312.description: Engineering properties of soil and their measurement. Effective-stress concept. Permeability and seepage. Compaction. Consolidation, shear strength, and stress-strain behavior.
CE312.prerequisite: ME 222 and (CE 273 or concurrently) and (CE 274 or concurrently)
CE312.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering and open to juniors or seniors in the Biosystems Engineering major.

CE321.name: Introduction to Fluid Mechanics
CE321.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE321.description: Fluid properties, fluid statics, fluids in motion. Conservation of mass, energy, and momentum. Dimensional analysis and similitude. Internal and external flows. Applications.
CE321.prerequisite: (MTH 235) and CE 221 and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
CE321.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering or in the Biosystems Engineering Major.

CE337.name: Civil Engineering Materials
CE337.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE337.description: Common civil engineering construction and paving materials
CE337.prerequisite: (ME 222 or concurrently) and (CE 273 or concurrently) and (CE 274 or concurrently)
CE337.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering.

CE341.name: Transportation Engineering
CE341.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE341.description: Overview of transportation system issues and problems. Fundamentals of highway design and operations. Planning and evaluation of transportation system alternatives.
CE341.prerequisite: ((MTH 234 or concurrently) or (MTH 254H or concurrently) or (LB 220 or concurrently)) and (((CE 273 or concurrently) and (CE 274 or concurrently)) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)
CE341.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering or in the Urban and Regional Planning major.

CE371.name: Sustainable Civil and Environmental Engineering Systems
CE371.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE371.description: Principles and tools of sustainable design and engineering economics in Civil and Environmental Engineering.
CE371.prerequisite: ((MTH 234 or concurrently) or (LB 220 or concurrently) or (MTH 254H or concurrently)) and ENE 280
CE371.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Civil Engineering Major or in the Environmental Engineering Major.

CE372.name: Risk Analysis in Civil and Environmental Engineering
CE372.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE372.description: Applications of probability, statistics, uncertainty and risk analysis to topics in civil and environmental engineering, characterization of system safety, and comparison tests for engineering quality control and environmental analyses.
CE372.prerequisite: (MTH 234 or concurrently) or (LB 220 or concurrently) or (MTH 254H or concurrently)
CE372.restrictions: Open to juniors in the Civil Engineering Major or in the Environmental Engineering Major and open to seniors in the Civil Engineering Major or in the Environmental Engineering Major.

CE400.name: Structural Mechanics
CE400.description: Matrix methods of structural analysis. Flexibility method. Direct stiffness method for plane structures. Elastic supports, inclined supports, member releases and non-prismatic members. Application software.
CE400.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE405.name: Design of Steel Structures
CE405.description: Design of steel beams, columns, tension members and connections. Stability and plastic strength.
CE405.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering or in the College of Engineering.

CE406.name: Design of Concrete Structures
CE406.description: Design of reinforced concrete beams, slabs, columns and footings.
CE406.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering or in the College of Engineering.

CE407.name: Materials Engineering: Properties, Selection and Processing
CE407.description: General families of materials, materials design process for civil and environmental engineering problems, structural materials properties, processing methods and environment, microstructure of materials, structural materials selection by utilizing bubble charts.
CE407.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Chemical Engineering Major or in the Mechanical Engineering Major or in the Civil Engineering Major.

CE418.name: Geotechnical Engineering
CE418.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE421.name: Engineering Hydrology
CE421.description: Hydrologic design of storm water systems. Equilibrium hydrograph analysis, unit hydrographs, infiltration, hydrograph synthesis, and reservoir routing. Groundwater
CE421.prerequisite: (CE 321) and (GLG 201 or GLG 301) and (CE 372 or STT 351)
CE421.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering or in the College of Natural Science or in the Department of Plant, Soil and Microbial Sciences.

CE422.name: Applied Hydraulics
CE422.description: Fundamentals of open-channel flow. Rapidly and gradually varied nonuniform flow analysis. Confined flows past submerged bodies, in pipe networks, and in turbo machinery. Design applications.
CE422.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE431.name: Pavement Design and Analysis
CE431.description: Highway and airfield pavement structural design. Performance measures. Failure mechanisms. Popular thickness design procedures. Design considerations for surface friction, pavement joints, and drainage.
CE431.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE432.name: Pavement Rehabilitation
CE432.description: Engineering concepts and information needed to rehabilitate pavements. Network and project survey and evaluation
CE432.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE444.name: Principles of Traffic Engineering
CE444.description: Driver and vehicle characteristics affecting traffic flow and safety. Speed, density, capacity relationships. Signal control in street networks. Freeway management systems. Risk management and liability.
CE444.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Civil Engineering Major.

CE448.name: Transportation Planning
CE448.description: Transportation planning process and procedures. Estimation of travel demand using traditional models of trip generation, trip distribution, modal split, and traffic assignment. Use of "quick-response" procedures. Traffic impact of new facilities.

CE449.name: Highway Design
CE449.description: Geometric design of highways. Operation, capacity, safety, and geometric features. Alignment, drainage and pavement design. Use of CAD systems in preparing contract plans.
CE449.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE461.name: Computational Methods in Civil Engineering
CE461.description: Theoretical, numerical, and computational methods for civil engineering problems. Physical modeling, numerical techniques, and programming methods. Focus on civil engineering dynamics, solving systems of differential equations, and visualizing the results.
CE461.prerequisite: (EGR 102 and CE 221) and (MTH 235 or MTH 340 or MTH 347H)
CE461.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Civil Engineering Major.

CE471.name: Construction Engineering - Equipment, Methods and Planning
CE471.description: Engineering and construction fundamentals of earthwork operations, moving of materials, concrete construction, formwork, false work, and other temporary structures. Relationship to a construction project's constructability, cost, and schedule.
CE471.prerequisite: (CE 305 and CE 312 and CE 337) or (CMP 305 and CMP 322)
CE471.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering or in the Department of Management or in the Construction Management major.

CE480.name: Environmental Measurements Laboratory
CE480.description: Basic chemical and microbiological methods used in the analysis of environmental media. Laboratory safety, quality assurance, quality control, and statistics used in laboratory analysis. Related technical communication, laboratory report writing.
CE480.prerequisite: (CEM 161 or CEM 185H or LB 171L) and ENE 280 and (CEM 142 or CEM 152 or CEM 182H or LB 172) and ((ENE 481 or concurrently) or (ENE 483 or concurrently)) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
CE480.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE481.name: Environmental Chemistry: Equilibrium Concepts
CE481.description: Chemistry of natural environmental systems and pollutants. Equilibrium concepts and calculations for acid-base, solubility, complexion, redox and phase partitioning reactions and processes. Applications to ecosystem analysis, pollutant fate and transport, and environmental protection.
CE481.prerequisite: {(CEM 141 and CEM 142) or (CEM 151 and CEM 152) or (CEM 181H and CEM 182H) or (LB 171 and LB 172)} and (ENE 280 or BE 230 or GLG 201 or GLG 301 or approval of department)

CE483.name: Water and Wastewater Engineering
CE483.description: Engineering and scientific basis and design of physical, chemical and biological methods for the treatment of drinking water and wastewater. Operation process selection and design. Field trips required.
CE483.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE485.name: Landfill Design
CE485.description: Geotechnical and environmental design of solid waste landfills.

CE487.name: Microbiology for Environmental Science and Engineering
CE487.description: Fundamentals of microbiology. Application of these concepts to environmental processes such as wastewater treatment, human health and bioremediation.

CE489.name: Air Pollution: Science and Engineering
CE489.description: Basic physical and chemical principles governing indoor and atmospheric air pollution. Elements of air pollution meteorology, climate change, atmospheric transformations and transport. Air pollution sources and methods for their control. The role of local, state and federal government in air pollution control.
CE489.prerequisite: (CEM 141 or CEM 151 or LB 171) and (MTH 133 or MTH 153H or LB 119) and (ENE 280 or BE 230) and (CE 321 or CHE 311)
CE489.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE490.name: Independent Study
CE490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CE490.description: Civil engineering problem of specific interest to the student and a faculty member. May be analysis or design.
CE490.restrictions: Open to seniors in the College of Engineering. Approval of department.

CE492.name: Selected Topics in Civil Engineering
CE492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE492.description: Selected topics related to construction engineering, fluid mechanics, geotechnical engineering, hydrology, pavements, structural engineering, or transportation engineering.

CE495.name: Senior Design in Civil and Environmental Engineering
CE495.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE495.description: Preliminary design. Application of design concepts in civil engineering. Integrated design solutions using geotechnical, hydrological, pavement, structural, environmental, and transportation considerations. Planning the design process. Design Specifications. Cost. Written and oral presentations. Issues of professional practice.
CE495.prerequisite: (CE 274 and CE 371 and CE 372) and (ENE 421 or ENE 422 or ENE 483 or ENE 489 or CE 418 or CE 431 or CE 405 or CE 406 or CE 444 or CE 449) and (ENE 421 or ENE 422 or ENE 483 or ENE 489 or CE 405 or CE 406 or CE 418 or CE 431 or CE 444 or CE 449) and (ENE 421 or ENE 422 or ENE 483 or ENE 489 or CE 405 or CE 406 or CE 418 or CE 431 or CE 444 or CE 449)
CE495.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Civil Engineering Major or in the Environmental Engineering Major.

CE801.name: Nonlinear Structural Mechanics
CE801.description: Theory and methods related to the nonlinear behavior and analysis of structures with focus on line-type elements in two dimensions. Inelastic behavior of structural materials. Stability of structures. Nonlinear behavior and analysis of members and structural systems. Methods for iterative solution strategies and use of special computer software.

CE802.name: Introduction to Dynamics and Earthquake Engineering
CE802.description: Dynamic response of single degree-of-freedom systems. Damping in structures and soils. Time domain and frequency domain methods. Analytical and numerical solution techniques. Earthquake response spectra.

CE803.name: Structural Dynamics
CE803.description: Dynamic analysis of beam, frame and truss structures. Classical and finite element formulations. Model analysis and numerical integration techniques. Response to earthquakes. Computing response using a finite element program.

CE804.name: Advanced Mechanics for Civil Infrastructure
CE804.description: Advanced linear mechanics. Potential energy principle. Finite element formulations. Applications to problems in structural, geotechnical and pavement engineering.
CE804.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE805.name: Advanced Design of Steel Structures
CE805.description: Flexural and torsional instability of columns and beams. Slender cross-sectional elements, design of beam-columns. Torsion, plastic design, plate girders, composite steel-concrete construction, connections.

CE806.name: Advanced Structural Concrete Design
CE806.description: Analysis and design of prestressed and conventionally reinforced concrete structures.

CE807.name: Seismic Structural Design
CE807.description: Theory and methods for the seismic design of buildings, bridges, and other structures. Emphasis on fundamental factors influencing and controlling structural response. Philosophies for ductile design, capacity design and performance- based design. Analysis of structural systems under seismic demands for design and assessment. Introduction to retrofit strategies.

CE808.name: Structural Fire Engineering
CE808.description: Fire safety, fire codes, and fire engineering design methods. High temperature material properties, and behavior of materials and structures exposed to fires. Fire resistance design of steel, concrete, composite and timber structures. Use of the computer program for thermal and structural analysis.

CE809.name: Advanced Composite Materials and Structures
CE809.description: Mechanics and design of advanced composite materials and structures and their use for civil infrastructure. Elastic anisotropy and failure theories. Micro- and macro-mechanical analysis of fiber-reinforced polymer composites, particulate composites, and nanocomposites. Analysis and behavior of laminated plates and shells. Design applications to civil and mechanical structures.

CE812.name: Properties of Soils
CE812.description: Saturated and unsaturated hydraulic properties, consolidation and shear strength properties, thermal properties, and numerical modeling. Laboratory determination of soil properties including, interpretation of experimental data.

CE813.name: Soil Dynamics
CE813.description: Wave propagation in visco-elastic media. Seismic site response analysis. Foundation vibrations. Dynamic soil properties. Soil liquefaction. Dynamic earth pressures. Computing dynamic response of continuous medium using a finite element program and the complex response method.

CE815.name: Selected Topics in Geotechnical Engineering
CE815.description: Selected topics related to soil stabilization, highway and airport soils, and frozen ground engineering.

CE818.name: Advanced Geotechnical Design
CE818.description: Foundations and earth retaining structures. Bearing capacity, settlement, and lateral resistance of deep foundations. Advanced design of retaining structures using in-situ test data. Numerical solution of geotechnical problems.

CE821.name: Groundwater Hydraulics
CE821.description: Physical properties of porous media. Equations of flow in saturated media. Flow nets, well flow and parameter measurement. Transport processes and the advective-dispersion equation for conservative contaminants.

CE822.name: Groundwater Modeling
CE822.description: Analysis and modeling of groundwater flow, surface water and groundwater interaction, and reactive contaminant transport. Applied numerical methods for solving groundwater flow and contaminant transport equations. Case studies.

CE829.name: Mixing and Transport in Surface Waters
CE829.description: Waves, tides and shallow-water processes. Numerical solutions and applications of shallow-water equations to lakes, rivers and estuaries. Principles and processes of sediment transport, and dispersion of materials in surface waters. Wind-driven circulation in Lake Michigan.

CE831.name: Advanced Concrete Pavement Analysis and Design
CE831.description: Theoretical models for analysis of concrete pavement systems. Impact of concrete material on pavement response and performance. Formulation of improved mechanistic structural design procedures.

CE832.name: Advanced Asphalt Pavement Analysis and Design
CE832.description: Mechanistic approach to asphalt pavement design. Analysis of asphalt pavement systems using theoretical models, asphalt material modeling, prediction, and performance. Formulation of improved mechanistic structural and mix design procedures.

CE835.name: Engineering Management of Pavement Networks
CE835.description: Theoretical and statistical analysis of pavement networks. Engineering monitoring. Determination of distress mechanisms and engineering solutions. Assignment of priorities to engineering actions.

CE836.name: Materials Science for Civil Engineers
CE836.description: Structure of materials and structure-property relationships. Principles and theories governing mechanical, physical, and durability characteristics of civil engineering materials. Material selection, production, and quality control.

CE837.name: Advanced Concrete Materials
CE837.description: Microstructure, engineering characteristics and modeling of concrete materials. Structure- property relationships in concrete materials. Control of concrete structure and properties for different infrastructure applications.

CE838.name: Bituminous Materials
CE838.description: Superpave asphalt mix design, binder tests, hot mix asphalt performance tests, viscoelasticity, continuum damage models, image analysis methods.

CE841.name: Traffic Flow Theory
CE841.description: Microscopic and macroscopic traffic flow models, Queueing theory. Gap acceptance. Simulation models for network analysis. Intelligent vehicle highway systems.

CE844.name: Highway and Traffic Safety
CE844.description: Analysis of highway geometric design alternatives and operational-control strategies with respect to accident probabilities. Statistical methods of pattern identification. Countermeasure selection and evaluation methodology. Risk management.

CE847.name: Traffic Analysis and Control
CE847.description: Modern traffic control and traffic modeling using state-of-the-art algorithms and computer models. Practical implications.

CE849.name: Transportation Research Methods
CE849.description: Application and interpretation of quantitative methods and design of experiments for transportation research; ANOVA, non-parametric, discriminant analysis, factor analysis, multivariate regression, SPSS.

CE850.name: Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS)
CE850.description: Technical and policy aspects emerging from the application of advanced technologies to transportation problems. Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) user services requirements, available and emerging technologies, case studies of ongoing operational tests, legal institutional and planning issues related to ITS development and deployment.

CE851.name: Transportation and the Environment
CE851.description: The impact of transportation systems on the environment. Elements of Environmental Impact Statements. Policy options and their consequences. Alternatives for reducing environmental impact.
CE851.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the College of Engineering.

CE872.name: Finite Element Method
CE872.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CE872.description: Theory and application of the finite element method to the solution of continuum type problems in heat transfer, fluid mechanics, and stress analysis.

CE878.name: Autonomous Futures: Self-driving Vehicles, Domotics, and Artificial Intelligence in Smart Cities
CE878.description: Characteristics of autonomous systems and emerging technology. Perceptions of people on future transport, mobility, housing, and living. International perspectives on ethics and transitions towards autonomous futures. Implications for engineering, policy, business, and planning.

CE880.name: Civil Engineering Seminar
CE880.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

CE890.name: Independent Study in Civil Engineering
CE890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CE890.description: Research problems of limited scope not pertaining to thesis accomplished under CE 899 or CE 999.
CE890.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering. Approval of department.

CE891.name: Selected Topics in Civil Engineering
CE891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CE891.description: Selected topics in new or developing areas of civil engineering.

CE892.name: Master's Research Project
CE892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CE892.description: Master's degree Plan B individual student research project. Original research, research replication, or survey and reporting on a research topic.
CE892.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Civil Engineering major. Approval of department.

CE899.name: Master's Thesis Research
CE899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

CE900.name: Research Strategies and Methods in Civil Engineering
CE900.description: Criteria for quality research, scientific method, scientific arguments, statistical testing, critical thinking skills, reviewing journal articles, literature synthesis, writing proposals and papers, giving presentations, responsible conduct of research.
CE900.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering.

CE990.name: Independent Study in Civil Engineering
CE990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CE990.description: Research problems of limited scope not pertaining to thesis accomplished under CE 999.
CE990.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Civil Engineering major.

CE999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
CE999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
